title: Standardize cards, add borders, sun/moon toggle, and fix CompTIA A+ card

requirements.summary: Add consistent visible border to all cards across Dashboard, Certifications, and Study Materials pages in both light and dark themes
acceptanceCriteria: All cards on the Dashboard page have a visible border in light and dark mode
All cards on the Certifications (CertificationSelector) page have a visible border in light and dark mode
All cards on the Study Materials page have a visible border in light and dark mode
Border style is consistent across all pages

file_operations.description: Add a global CSS utility class for card borders that works in both light and dark themes, using the existing OKLCH color system. The border should be clearly visible with appropriate contrast in both themes (e.g., using border-color with a semi-transparent value or a dedicated border custom property).

Apply the new consistent border class to all certification card elements in the Study Materials page. Each card currently uses rounded-lg and other styling; add the border utility to make card boundaries clearly visible.
Apply the consistent border class to all certification card elements on the Dashboard page, ensuring the border is visible around each card and its progress indicator.
Apply the consistent border class to all certification card elements on the Certifications (CertificationSelector) page to match the styling applied to Dashboard and Study Materials cards.

Clicking the icon switches between light and dark mode
Sun icon is shown when in dark mode, moon icon is shown in light mode
Toggle is visible and accessible in the sticky header on all pages

file_operations.description: Replace the existing dark/light mode toggle button in the Layout navbar with an icon-based button. When the app is in light mode, display a moon üåô icon (to indicate switching to dark); when in dark mode, display a sun ‚òÄÔ∏è icon (to indicate switching to light). requirements.summary: Set uniform fixed card size site-wide for all certification cards based on the largest card dimensions
acceptanceCriteria: All certification cards on Dashboard, Certifications, and Study Materials pages share the same fixed width and minimum height
Card dimensions do not shift or reflow when navigating between pages
Content within cards remains properly laid out and does not overflow the fixed card size

file_operations.description: Add a global utility class for certification card dimensions (e.g., .cert-card-standard) that defines a fixed width and min-height based on the largest card visible on the Study Materials page. Measure the card dimensions from the current layout and apply them as fixed values so all cards maintain consistent size across all pages.

Apply the uniform card size utility class to all certification cards on the Study Materials page. Ensure content layout (badge, title, description, button) remains properly aligned within the fixed card dimensions.
Apply the uniform card size utility class to all certification cards on the Dashboard page, ensuring that progress bars and action links fit within the fixed card size without overflow.
Apply the uniform card size utility class to all certification cards on the Certifications page, ensuring domain previews and exam details fit properly within the standardized card dimensions.

requirements.summary: Standardize CompTIA A+ card header to match other certification cards by adding badge pill outline and removing extra subtitle text
acceptanceCriteria: The A+ label on all CompTIA A+ cards has a bordered pill/badge outline matching the style of other certification badge pills
The text 'Core 1 (220-1101) & Core 2 (220-1102)' is removed from the CompTIA A+ card header across all pages
The CompTIA A+ card header layout visually matches the header layout of Security+, Network+, and other certification cards

file_operations.description: Update the CompTIA A+ card to add a badge pill outline around the 'A+' label matching the visual style of Security+, Network+, Linux+, and other certification badges. Remove the subtitle text 'Core 1 (220-1101) & Core 2 (220-1102)' from the card header so the A+ card layout matches the clean header style of other certifications.

Update the CompTIA A+ card on the Dashboard to add a badge pill outline around the 'A+' label and remove the subtitle text 'Core 1 (220-1101) & Core 2 (220-1102)', ensuring consistency with the Study Materials page and other certification cards.

Update the CompTIA A+ card on the Certifications (CertificationSelector) page to add a badge pill outline around the 'A+' label and remove the subtitle text 'Core 1 (220-1101) & Core 2 (220-1102)', ensuring the card header matches the standardized layout applied on other pages.
